name: Alex Morgan
bio: Two-time FIFA Women's World Cup champion and Olympic gold medalist who follows a vegan diet for ethical and performance reasons.

name: Alexey Voyevoda
bio: 2014 Olympic 2× gold medalist (bobsled); 3× World arm-wrestling champion (Russia)

name: Barny du Plessis
bio: 2014 Mr. Universe bodybuilding champion (United Kingdom)

name: Cam Newton
bio: NFL MVP (2015); led Carolina Panthers to Super Bowl 50 (United States)

name: Carl Lewis
bio: 9× Olympic gold (100m, 200m, 4×100m relay, long jump) (United States)

name: Christine Vardaros
bio: American professional cyclist competing internationally while following a vegan diet since 2000.

name: Colin Kaepernick
bio: Led San Francisco 49ers to Super Bowl XLVII (2013); civil rights activist (United States)

name: David Haye
bio: Unified World Cruiserweight Champion (2008); WBA World Heavyweight Champion (2009) (United Kingdom)

name: Dotsie Bausch
bio: Olympic silver medalist (2012 track cycling team pursuit) (United States)

name: Fiona Oakes
bio: British marathon runner and multiple world record holder, vegan since the age of six.

name: Hannah Teter
bio: 2006 Olympic gold & 2010 silver (halfpipe); 6× X Games medalist (United States)

name: Héctor Bellerín
bio: Spanish professional footballer who adopted a vegan lifestyle in 2017 to improve recovery and support animal welfare.

name: James Wilks
bio: Retired MMA fighter and producer of 'The Game Changers', advocating for plant-based performance.

name: Jermain Defoe
bio: 162 Premier League goals (9th all-time); 57 England caps, 20 goals (United Kingdom)

name: Kendrick Farris
bio: 3× Olympian; USA record holder (94kg class snatch & total) (United States)

name: Kyrie Irving
bio: NBA champion and Olympic gold medalist who adopted a plant-based diet for improved energy and performance.

name: Lewis Hamilton
bio: Seven-time Formula 1 World Champion who adopted a vegan diet in 2017 for health, environmental, and ethical reasons.

name: Mac Danzig
bio: UFC fighter & The Ultimate Fighter Season 6 winner (2007) (United States)

name: Meagan Duhamel
bio: Canadian Olympic gold medalist in figure skating who has been vegan since 2008.

name: Morgan Mitchell
bio: Australian Olympic sprinter who transitioned to veganism in 2014 for health and ethical reasons.

name: Nate Diaz
bio: UFC fighter who has followed a plant-based diet since 2010 for performance and recovery.

name: Novak Djokovic
bio: 24× Grand Slam singles champion; 5× year-end World No.1; Olympic bronze medalist (Serbia)

name: Patrik Baboumian
bio: German strongman and former bodybuilder who holds multiple world records and is a prominent advocate for plant-based diets.

name: Rich Roll
bio: Ultraman World Championships top-10 finisher; author of "Finding Ultra"; 5 Ironmans in 7 days finisher (United States)

name: Scott Jurek
bio: One of the most dominant ultramarathon runners in history, winning numerous 100-mile races on a vegan diet.

name: Seba Johnson
bio: Olympic alpine skier and animal rights activist, vegan since birth.

name: Tia Blanco
bio: Professional surfer and gold medalist at the ISA World Surfing Games, vegan since 2013.

name: Venus Williams
bio: Seven-time Grand Slam singles champion who adopted a vegan diet in 2011 after being diagnosed with Sjögren's syndrome.
